On Wed, Mar 12, 2008 at 12:52 AM, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:

> =
In my not so humble opinion, a complex method is a serious design smell

Fo=
r unit tests, yes.  For integration/functional tests, it's pretty common.

=
Stefan, for what it's worth, TestNG lets you specify such dependencies, e.g=
.

@Test
public void startApplicationServer() { ... }

@Test(dependsOnMetho=
ds =3D { "startApplicationServer"})
public void sendToServlet() { ... }

If=
 startApplicationServer() fails, sendToServlet() will not be run and
marked=
 as a SKIP.  You can also specify these dependencies on entire
groups of me=
thods (less fragile than the code above).

> So I'd rather change the desig=
n so that it's not so complex anymore

Don't we all/?  :-)

-- 
C=E9dric
